fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
1. Create new Fabric page 
2. Write some content. 
3. Open permissions dialog and set permission to private. 
4. Press apply

h3. Environment
http://hello.atlassian.net

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1
 # Step 2

h3. Expected Results
Private permissions will be applied.

h3. Actual Results
`There was an error submitting the page restrictions. Please try again later.` shown. 
403 error thrown in console.
The below exception is thrown in the console:
{noformat}
403

https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/setcontentpermissions.action?viewPermissionsUsers=8a7f80835cb16a63015cb39f69970164&editPermissionsUsers=8a7f80835cb16a63015cb39f69970164&viewPermissionsGroups=&editPermissionsGroups=&contentId=387864506&atl_token=<striped token>

{
    "actionErrors": [
        "Your session has expired. You may need to re-submit the form or reload the page."
    ]
}
{noformat}

h3. Notes
Previously it was possible top repeat `apply` couple of times and it was working. Now it is constantly happening. So I guess there is sometime "accumulated" in the state.

h3. Workaround
No workaround anymore due to `notes`.
fields.summary: User unable to change permissions for the page and getting 403 error instead.

fields.description:
*Summary*
When you select "Components" as a "Statistic Type" in the "Issue Statistics" macro, the results are not correct. They count each component as an issue, returning the incorrect number of total issues. E.g: if an issue has 3 components, this issue will count as 3 in the total issues number.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a project in Jira
# Create a few components
# Create a few issues with multiple components
# Go to a Confluence page in the edit mode
# Add the *Issue Statistics* macro
# Add a filter of the Jira project
# In the field *Statistic Type*, select *Components*
# Save the Macro
# See the results

*Expected Results*
The correct number of issues

*Actual Results*
The sum of the number of the components in each issue. The filter had only two issues, with 4 components each, but the macro has returned 8 issues
!Results.png|thumbnail! 
----
!Results 02.png|thumbnail! 
Same filter, different results
----
h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Issue statistics macro - returning the wrong number of total issues

fields.description:
h3. Current behavior 
It isn't possible to gather data regarding Confluence history search. 

It would be great if we could provide admins this functionality.
fields.summary: Ability to export search history from users

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

PDF export doesn't render web images in Confluence.

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
 # When viewing an image from Jira
# Right click and select *copy image*
# Paste this on a Confluence page.
# Export that image to pdf and noticed that the image doesn't render. 

h3. *Expected Results*

The image should be rendered on pdf export. 

h3. *Actual Results*

Images was gone from the pdf file .

h3. *Note*

* The process of attaching Jira image should be improved to allow the file to store on local Confluence storage. 
* Some Web images that are not coming from Jira are also affected

h3. *Workaround*
 # Embed the image as the attachment on Confluence.
fields.summary: PDF export doesn't render web images

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Emojis aren't visible for anonymous users when accessing public pages. (Either through Anonymous Access or Public Links)

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure a page to public access 
 # Add emojis to the page
# Access the page being logged out of your account / through a Public Link

h3. Expected Results
The page should show all emojis correctly.

h3. Actual Results
The page is showing a emoji name instead of the emoji itself. e.g.: {{:warning:}} instead of (!)

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Emojis aren't visible for anonymous users

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Confluence Questions notifications aren't being delivered
h3. Description

Currently, if you add yourself as a watcher of all questions and/or specific spaces in Confluence Questions you will not receive notifications about it in your e-mail.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a Confluence Cloud instance with Confluence Questions installed, add yourself as a watcher of all questions
 # Ask a different user to post a question

h3. Expected Results

You receive an e-mail notification regarding the question that was posted.
h3. Actual Results

You receive no e-mail notifications.
h3. Notes

Currently, no notifications are sent at all, including new answers.

*This problem only affects certain instances.* The current theory is that it only affects certain users - specifically certain email addresses.
h3. Workaround

Navigate to the *Security Configuration* settings menu (Confluence home -> Settings -> Security Configuration) as an admin. Change the *User email visibility* setting to *public*.
fields.summary: Confluence Questions notifications are not being sent

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Markdown proposed: {{![alt text](url)}}  doesn't function either with cut and pasting neither with typing the address. The image link is recognised as a URL and then preventing the markdown syntax to function. In case of typing the address the final ")" is included in the url so even the link is broken.

Recording: http://recordit.co/GdCRrhV0V3

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Typing markdown syntax to insert image is broken, but pasting it works in Jira

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

Profile macro failed to load when user email contain special characters with an error message replacing the macro:
{code}
Error rendering macro 'profile-picture' : null
{code}

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
 # Create a email with special characters - for example: an apostrophe character
 # Invite this email to the instance
 # Create a page with profile picture macro referencing this users, 


h3. *Expected Results*

Profile picture macro load without issue

h3. *Actual Results*

Profile picture macro failed to load


h3. *Workaround*
None, unless:

# If at all possible, change email address to have no special characters.
# Place a profile picture manually for the offending user profile with an email address containing an apostrophe.
fields.summary: Profile picture macro fails to load when an email address contains special characters

fields.description: search should support searching of spaces by the space key (specifically in the restrictions dialog). This is much shorter and easier to remember than space names and should be supported.
fields.summary: Allow searching of spacekey

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Popular feed shows stale results.

 

Example:

[!Screen Shot 2019-01-23 at 1.08.58 PM.png?default=false|thumbnail!|https://hello.atlassian.net/secure/attachment/332053/332053_Screen+Shot+2019-01-23+at+1.08.58+PM.png]

A page from Jan 14 with fewer likes and comments and a page from yesterday with 5 comments is above a blog post from 2 hours ago with more likes and comments.

 
h3. Workaround

none
fields.summary: Popular feed is stale

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The bug was found when vendor was testing their macro but this issue affects any macro using "confluence-content" parameters. This affects both Cloud and Server. 

_All details here are provided by the vendor_

Replication steps:

Preparation (in space SRC):
 # Add a macro that takes a page as a parameter to a page A
 # Set page C in the current space (SRC) as the value of the parameter

Different variants of the bug:
 # Copy-paste the macro:
 ## Open editor for the page A
 ## Select the macro placeholder in editor and choose copy
 ## Open editor for a page B in another space DEST
 ## Paste the macro from page A to the editor for page B
 ## Save page B
 -> the macro does not point to the page SRC:C anymore
 -> unless the DEST space has a page with title C the macro breaks (eg "unable to render \{include}
The page could not be found" is shown)

 # Copy page and change location in editor to new space
 ## Open the page A
 ## Choose copy
 ## In the editor opened for copy of page A, click 'location' (next to breadcrumb)
 ## Choose a page in another space (eg DEST) as the new parent
 ## Save
 -> same problems as in variant A
 # Copy page directly to new space (without children)
 ## same as B but choose a parent page in different space already in the "pick location" dialog opened after clicking on "copy"
 ## the "pick location" dialog is not shown at all on Cloud, so 3rd affects only Server

h3. Expected

When macro is copied to new space the relative link to a page in its original space is qualified with the original space key (turned into an absolute link)
h3. Actual

The link breaks
h3. Affects/Impact

This affects any macro saving a page reference to a macro parameter with type "confluence-content" (for example "Include page" or "Excerpt include")

*Customer Installation Impacts: 1,215*
h3. Notes
- in all cases using a Link to page A works correctly but macro parameters break
- the macro user (or developer) cannot choose to use an absolute link to a page in current space by qualifying with the space key when setting the parameter value. Confluence will automatically (in some cases) turn links to pages in current space to be relative (always using absolute references would also solve the problems with page titles including ':'...)
- the copy operations seem to work correctly when the editor is not involved, so the bug is in handling the macro parameters in "editor format" (ie the data-macro-* attributes on the macro placeholder)
- have not tested if this happens also with macros with body, it happens at least for any bodiless macro
- tested on Confluence Cloud, and Confluence 6.0 + 6.12 on Server

h3. Workaround
No current workaround. This will be change once a workaround is possible
fields.summary: Macro parameters referencing pages in current space break when copying to new space

fields.description:
Hey team, 

Please update the following documentation from Confluence Cloud:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/move-copy-and-hide-pages-724764858.html

From:

{quote}
# Go to a page in the space and tap, then select Copy.
Confluence will open a copy of the page in the editor. 
# Rename the page and make any other changes in the body of the page.
# If you need to move the new page to a different space or a different parent, choose Location at the bottom-left of the page. 
# Choose Save.
{quote}

To:

{quote}
# Go to a page in the space and tap , then select Copy.
Confluence will open a copy of the page in the editor. 
# Rename the page and make any other changes in the body of the page.
# If you need to move the new page to a different space or a different parent, choose Location at the bottom-left of the page. 
{quote}

Thank you!
fields.summary: Update "Copy a page" official documentation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Confluence, when a page has a lot of content (e.g. macros, information from macros, attachments and a lot of images), the page will take some time to render, but, indeed, either it will not be rendered, or, a timeout like the following will be displayed:

{code}
Error: GraphQL error: Timeout error querying the remote graphql service.
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Confluence, make sure to create a page that will have a lot of content to be rendered. Specific examples could be related to the [User list macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/user-list-macro-724765305.html] when trying to retrieve the users from a (default, mostly) group with a lot of users (like 2000).
 # If there are no errors saving the content, try to publish the page.

h3. Expected Results
The page should render properly, or, after a while, have the content rendering properly.

h3. Actual Results
The page will take a while to load, and eventually, it will fail with a message like above, or, simply not have the content rendering, with only errors from the browser's console.

h3. Notes

Reports and tests come typically from the following scenarios:

* Pages using multiple Jira issues macro separately, or, using a JQL that will retrieve a lot of content.
* Using the *user-list* macro with default groups like *confluence-users* when having a lot of users.
* *Blog Posts* macro when using the parameter to show all the content of the blog and having a lot of blogs on the instance
* Multiple "Excerpt-includes" macros on the page.
* Multiple "Expand" macros on the page
* Content by label macros with a lot of pages to be rendered

h3. Workaround
Split the content of the pages into multiple pages, or, use a simple view method from macros that allow so, like the "Blog Posts" macro.
fields.summary: Pages with too much content will timeout while trying to be rendered

h3. Page Tree doesn't reflect impersonated user's permissions/restrictions

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# As a *site-admin*, restrict a page to your user only, in a space where other user (non-admin) has access
# Go to *User Management* and impersonate that user's profile
# Go to that space and check the page tree

h3. Expected Results
You won't see restricted pages.

h3. Actual Results
The pages are displayed in the page tree, but once you click them, it displays a message saying that "You don't have permission to view this page. Request access from the author."

h3. Notes
It doesn't happen for the actual user. This problem only happens during impersonating sessions.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Page Tree doesn't reflect impersonated user's permissions/restrictions

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using the [Page Properties macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/page-properties-macro-724765240.html] in combination with the [Page Properties report|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/page-properties-report-macro-724765250.html] in the new editor, if the user tries to specify which columns will be displayed on the report, the changes will not be applied and all columns will continue to display.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Confluence, make sure to create a new page using the new/legacy editor to insert a table (using the first row as the header, according to [how the macro is inserted|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/page-properties-macro-724765240.html#PagePropertiesMacro-AddingthePagePropertiesmacrotoapage]) in order to have multiple information being displayed for the report.
# Create a new page that will be using the new editor and insert the *Page properties report* macro.
# On the macro configuration (tapping to *edit* the same), make sure to tap the *show* button in the *options* part, and then, fill the *Columns to show* field with the name of the previously created table, so it will not include all of them and allow the bug to be triggered. Notice that the *Preview* will display the columns as expected, without any symptoms for the bug.
# *Save* the configuration

h3. Expected Results
The configuration should be saved and start to display only the specified columns, according to the mentioned field.

h3. Actual Results
Once the configuration is saved and the edit dialog is closed, all of the columns from the *Page properties* will be displayed, ignoring the modification. 

h3. Notes
* The bug happens only with the Page Properties report macro in pages that will be using the new editor.
* If trying to retrieve the information from a page using the legacy editor, the bug will happen in the new editor as well.
* If trying to retrieve a *Page Properties* from the new editor into the legacy one, this bug will not happen.

h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: "Columns to show" not working on Page Properties Report macro for the new editor

fields.description:
h3. Summary
I have a macro that needs to store N (which might be really high) references to Confluence pages.

The solution I would want to use is to have a macro parameter of type "confluence-content" allowing multiple values ("multiple"=true)

Now I get the page references as a list of  'space-key:page-title' entries separated by ',' characters

However, a page title can contain ',' characters, and in this case I cannot correctly split the macro parameter string value to individual page references

For example, if I have a page with title "One, Two, and Three" and another page with title "Four", both in current space, the macro parameter string value could look like:
"One, Two, and Three,Four"
-> when parsing the parameter string value, it is not possible to know which ',' are part of titles and which ones should be separators

On Confluence Server you can define a custom separator like:
{code}
<parameter name="multiRef" type="confluence-content" multiple="true">
             <option key="delimiter" value="-!!!!!-"/>
</parameter>
{code}
i.e. you can set the delimiter string to some value that is really unlikely to happen inside a page title.

I would need to do the same on Confluence Cloud but "delimiter" parameter is not specified here:
https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/modules/macro-input-parameter/
and it did not work either when I tested setting it anyway
fields.summary: Custom delimiter for Confluence macro parameter with multiple values

fields.description:
As part of GDPR changes, user keys are no longer provided in webhooks. As a result apps lose the ability to identify system apps.

The requirement is captured in this developer community thread: [https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/question-about-accountid/25619/16]

Please provide information about the account type in the webhook payload.
fields.summary: Provide Account Type in Webhooks

fields.description:
In Confluence, when the user uses the ability to highlight text and create a new Jira macro, the *Summary* and *Description* field will be coming by default, and the same will have dropdown options in order to have it matching with Jira's information.

However, when required fields are inserted into the specific project/project type in Jira, the same will be displayed for Confluence, but, as a simple text field. Since the user will manually need to insert the text/content, this can be disruptive and time-consuming as this would add extra steps to identify the specific field and its information.

This is a suggestion to have the required (or any other) fields using dropdowns instead of simple text option when creating Jira issues directly from Confluence's highlighting ability.
fields.summary: Dropdown for required fields when highlighting text to Jira issues

h3. Summary
Using a 3rd-party macro in a Space or Global template does not render in the preview when a page/content is created by using the template.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install GoodSoftware's from "Macro Toolbox" (https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1215202/macro-toolbox-html-tabs-expand?hosting=cloud&tab=overview) to Confluence instance
# Create a new template
# Add the "List expand" macro
# Create a variable within the macro's body
# Save the template
# Create a new page using that new template

h3. Expected Results
# Macros should render correctly in the preview of a "user created template". 
# The JS API AP.confluence.getMacroBody method should return the macro body in this context

h3. Actual Results
The macros don't render and/or show an error. The JS API returns an error when the macro body is requested

h3. Notes
* Tried other 3rd-party Macros and it behaves the same
* Since you’re unable to select a value for the template variables in the wizard step, the macro body will render empty
* Publishing the page is successful
* The error our macros return is not caused by an Atlassian permissions error, but by our macro not being able to get its own body from the Confluence REST API
* Videos can be seen in [DEVHELP-2109|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/DEVHELP-2109]. Video file size exceeds the max allowable attachment size here
fields.summary: Macro body not rendering inside preview of user created template

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the Jira Issues Count macro (project with thousands of issues in it) inside another Macro (Char, Info, Note, etc) the page and editing macro settings loads ~30s+, which sometimes is unresponsive or server error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Steps:
# Add Info macro to the page.
# Add Jira Issues Count macro inside Info macro.
# Edit Info macro and update its title.
# Update the macro - works fast.
# Add more Jira Issues Count macros and repeat steps 3-4: it will take more time to update the macro or even it won't be updated at all.

or using the Jira Issues Count macro inside a chart:
# Add chart macro to the page.
# Add a table with Jira Issues Count macro inside Info macro. Please choose a project with thousands of issues in it
# Edit chart macro and update its title.
# Update the macro - works fast.
# Add more Jira Issues Count macros and repeat steps 3-4: it will take more time to update the macro or even it won't be updated at all.
# Try to save and view the page and the page loads so slow

Video:  [^2019-01-08_10h15_52.mp4]  [^macro as test user.mov] 
Sample screenshots:
 !Screen Shot 2018-12-14 at 3.41.50 PM.png|thumbnail! - [errormsg.mp4|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customershim/secure/attachment/3364585/3364585_errormsg.mp4?fromIssue=2504106]

h3. Expected Results
The page should be displayed at a reasonable amount of time and macro settings should be editable

h3. Actual Results
Page loads at a rate of ~30s-1m and macro settings sometimes uneditable

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Macro update takes a lot of time when there are Jira Issues Count macro with plenty of issues which sometimes results in not being able to update it

fields.description:
Allow Confluence Admins to assign prefered spaces to users, so once they are provided access to the desired space by their Admins it would be added to the "My Spaces" sidebar. (the current method requires the user to manually "star" a space so it can be shown under "My Spaces") 

"Confluence should show the assigned spaces just like Jira shows the assigned Projects. It would easier to use."

fields.description:
It took me no less than 5 minutes to work out how to add a page.

Once I found the "+" on the far (unrelated) left bar, I then invited a colleague to add a new page, and they too were unable to find the "Create" function quickly.

May I suggest that you either move - or add - the create 'button' alongside the "Edit" / "Save for later" etc. buttons?

Or even make it a part of the menu dropdown at the end of that row of buttons.

The toolbar at the far left looks 'disconnected' from the rest of the page somehow - it doesn't integrate with the rest of the page at all.
fields.summary: Create page 'button' (the '+') location.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Page editor freezes if, while editing a Meeting Notes page, you open the Jira Issue Macro dialog and click *esc* to escape it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enter edit mode in a Meeting Notes page;
# Select the Jira Issue Macro;
# While in the Jira Issue Macro dialog click *esc*;

h3. Expected Results
The Jira Issue Macro dialog closes and you can keep editing your page.

h3. Actual Results
The page editor freezes.

h3. Workaround
It is necessary to refresh the page (sometimes a hard refresh is necessary) to be able to keep editing the page.
fields.summary: Meeting Notes editor freezes if escaping out of a Jira Issue Macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Similar to [CONFCLOUD-57539|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-57539], in a Confluence that is opened for anonymous users, if the same tries to click on a page URL (not the Overview/Home page of the space  one) from a space that *does not have anonymous access* enabled, a blank page will be displayed:

!blank.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# As an administrator of Confluence, go to *Settings* and *Global Permissions*, so you can *edit* it.
# Make sure to check the *Can use* checkbox for the "*Anonymous users*" section.
# *Save* the change and go back in order to create a new space.
# Create a new space in Confluence and make sure that the same *is not open for anonymous access*.
# Create a new page on the space, so it will not be the *homepage*.
# Copy and send this URL for a user that is not a member of Confluence *and does not have an Atlassian Account*

h3. Expected Results
The anonymous should be prompt with a 404 message or a login prompt, as the Overview page works on this topic.

h3. Actual Results
Only a blank page without any content (affecting the sidebar as well) will be displayed.

h3. Notes
* The overview page does not present the same behavior. Instead, anonymous users will be prompt with a login window.
* This will only happen if the Global Permissions are allowing anonymous users to access the instance.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior, besides removing anonymous access.
fields.summary: Accessing a page URL as anonymous (without Atlassian Account) will result in a blank page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

For Connect apps that have opted in to GDPR, macro parameters of type username are not properly resolved as iframe URL context parameters when multiple users have been selected.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install a Connect app that defines a macro with a username parameter.
 # Insert an instance of the macro, selecting multiple users for the username parameter.
 # Load the page containing the macro.

h3. Expected Results

If the app has not opted in to GDPR, the context parameter for the username parameter resolves to a comma-separated list of usernames, and an additional context parameter with the ".accountId" suffix resolves to a comma-separated list of account IDs.

If the app has opted in to GDPR, the context parameter for the username parameter resolves to a comma-separated list of account IDs.
h3. Actual Results

The context parameters that should be lists of account IDs are empty.
h3. Workaround

Opt out of Connect GDPR API migration.
fields.summary: Connect context parameter for username macro parameter with multiple values is returned empty

fields.description:
*Summary:*
When a subscription for the page is created and configured for granular notifications, it's not working as expected.

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Make sure that Slack notifications are enabled at the Cloud site level and on a particular space level.
# Take a URL of the page from the space on the Cloud site.
# Go to Slack channel, and use below command.
{noformat}
/confluence connect 'url of the page from step 2'
{noformat}
# Confirm the subscription for the page by click on the 'Page' button.
# Now go to Cloud site > Space settings > Integrations > Slack Notifications
# Click on the pencil icon to edit Slack subscription for that page.
 !Screen Shot.png|thumbnail! 
# Choose only _Adds a child page_ and unselect remaining options, and save changes.
 !Edit Notifications.png|thumbnail! 
# Add a comment on the page.

*Expected Result:*
The comment should not send the notification to the slack channel as the _Comments on this page_ is not selected in the config.

*Actual Result:*
Comment is notified in the Slack channel.

*Notes:*
Similar behavior is observed for other options: _Edits this page_, _Edits a child page_ and _Comments on a child page_ as well.

*Workaround:*
No known workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Slack Notifications do not respect granular configuration

fields.description:
h2. Issue Summary
Users are presented with keystroke slowness when editing content wrapped by multiple _<div class="table-wrap">_ elements. The editor becomes slow when publishing page changes and the copy page operation may also timeout.

h2. Steps to Replicate
It is unknown how a page would get into a state where an element is wrapped by multiple _<div class="table-wrap">_ elements, but, this may be a slight variation of the bug described in [CONFSERVER-51834|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51834]. Corrupted pages may contribute to bigger levels of nesting.

h2. How it Looks Like - How to Diagnose the Issue
If typing text to a page is a slow operation to you, right click the slowness spot in the page and click on Inspect Element (instructions for Chrome, other browsers may vary a little bit). You shall see something like this:
!Screen Shot 2019-01-10 at 19.19.20.png|thumbnail!

This is just the top of the iceberg. Some elements can be wrapped by more than 200 other elements:
{code}
<div class="sc-cMhqgX fhMABA"><div><div><div><div class="page view"><div class="wiki-content"><div class="table-wrap"><div class="table-wrap"><div class="table-wrap"><div class="table-wrap"><div class="sc-fHSTwm eoPpdC"><div class="page view"><div class="wiki-content"><div class="table-wrap"><div class="table-wrap" style="text-decoration: none;"><div class="table-wrap"><div class="table-wrap"><div class="table-wrap"><div class="table-wrap"><div class="table-wrap"><div class="table-wrap">
{code}

Typing into text that's included in between these elements is extremely slow due to the complexity that they introduce, which causes the keystroke slowness.

h2. Workaround
Working around this issue requires manual efforts and a little bit of HTML knowledge. Instructions below represent one of many possible workarounds. In case of any doubts when following this, [engage Support for assistance|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/].
# Export the slow page as HTML.
## To do so, you must be at least a Space Admin.
## Access Space Settings in the Space which the affected page belongs to.
## Click on Content Tools.
## Click on Export.
## Select HTML and then finish the Export process.
# Clear up nested tags using Chrome Developer Tools.
## You are going to drag and drop the exported HTML Page to an empty Chrome Tab.
## With that done, go to the spot where the slowness happens and click on Inspect Element.
## Now, this is the tricky part. We are going to use the drag and drop feature of the Chrome Developer tools to do so.
## Using below screenshot as a reference, expand as much elements as possible.
!Screen Shot 2019-01-10 at 19.19.20.png|thumbnail!
## As can be seen here, we have tons of _table-wrap_ elements below the _wiki-content_ element.
## The exercise consists of pretty much clicking in the last _table-wrap_ element of the list and dragging it below the _wiki-content element until we have reduced it to an acceptable range of wraps.
## Once that's done, we need to scroll-up to the head element, right click on it and save as HTML.
## You are going to use this HTML to replace the HTML of the page exported earlier.
# Upload the XML Export back to Cloud
## Once that page is saved and had its HTML modified, just zip all elements of the export back into the original zip file.
## We are now going to follow the reverse route and Import that XML into your Confluence Cloud instance.
## To do so, you must be at least a Space Admin.
## Access Space Settings in the Space which the affected page belongs to.
## Click on Content Tools.
## Click on Import.
## Select HTML and then finish the Import process.
## Once that's completed, you will have the worked around page in your instance.
## Just copy it to the space in which it needs to be and the issue shall be solved.

(!) There's a possibility that some of the formatting is lost, so, get ready to fix part of it if needed. Content though should remain the same.

h2. Tools that may be of Assistance
* [HTML to XHTML Converter|http://www.it.uc3m.es/jaf/cgi-bin/html2xhtml.cgi]
* [HTML Formatter|https://countwordsfree.com/html-formatter]
fields.summary: Editor becomes slow when page has multiple table-wrap elements

# Create a page in Confluence with anchor links(same page).

fields.description:
In Confluence, in order to track specific actions, it is recommended to use the [Audit logs option|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/audit-log-802164269.html] or add-ons that could help on analytics tracking for users. For Service Desk, the same can be accessed through the [administration of the site|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/blog/2017/04/new-and-improved-audit-logs].

However, for specific actions like tracking downloads/uploads of attachments, there are no metrics to be seen and this could be really useful for data reports. This is a suggestion to allow Confluence/Jira Service Desk to track the download/upload of attachments and provide which user did the same.
fields.summary: Ability to track customer's action when linking with Service Desk

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the New Editor, it is not possible to add an image in a line that also contains text.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a instance with the new editor enabled, create a new page
# Add an image (.PNG, .JPG) as an attachment
# Try to add text in the same line as the image's thumbnail

h3. Expected Results
Text is added within the same line

h3. Actual Results
It's not possible to add text and images in the same line

h3. Workaround
# Go to *Emoji* in the toolbar
# Click *Add New Emoji*
# Set a emoji shortcut
# Upload the file you want to add in-line

h3. Notes
* Pages migrated from old editor to the new one, that contains inline images, might stop displaying those images. They'll show up as {{inlineExtension}} in published mode, instead.
* This behavior is also present when importing word documents as pages - Images that have text on the same line will be replaced by *inlineExtension* placeholders on the final page. (This can be replicated using the annexed .docx file)
*  [^this is an inline image.docx]
fields.summary: Inline images in the new editor

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The ability to reorder pages by drag-and-drop from the sidebar is causing us a lot of problems, because of accidental dragging and dropping, e.g. when using a laptop trackpad.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an ability to disable this new "feature" or what it can be done so that by design this issue can be avoided (locking the sidebar from these changes, or allowing only selected users to reorder pages, without affecting their ability to create pages, etc.)
fields.summary: Ability to disable the new feature to reorder pages
AP.confluence.getMacroBody on page edit returns an empty body in the new Confluence editor

fields.description:
When creating a new space with group permissions through the REST api, the group names are always saved in lower case. This means that if there exists a group with uppercase characters, there is no way to add it in the space permissions when using the REST api.

*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Create a group and give it the name "FOO" (uppercase)
 # Create a space with the REST api and pass in a space permission for "FOO" (uppercase) as the group name
or
Create a space with the REST api and pass in a space permission for "Foo" (lowercase / any case) as the group name

*What happens:*

The space permission is saved as a group space permission of "foo" (lowercase) and does not work.

*What should happen:*

The space permission should always be saved in the correct case, no matter what casing the input is supplied as (ie, either "FOO" or "foo" or "Foo").
fields.summary: Group names in space permissions are saved in incorrect case through the REST api

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Previewing Table of Content Macro on new Editor does not work, the following error is displayed on the macro's preview modal:
{code}
Error rendering macro 'toc' : [com.ctc.wstx.exc.WstxLazyException] com.ctc.wstx.exc.WstxParsingException: Duplicate attribute 'src'. at [row,col {unknown-source}]: [1,3466]
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page
# Insert some Headers on it
# Insert a ToC macro on the top of the page
# Hover over the macro and click on the *Pencil* icon

h3. Expected Results
You should be able to preview the ToC

h3. Actual Results
The error is displayed on the macro's modal.

h3. Workaround
Publish the page to view the result of the macro.
fields.summary: Previewing Table of Content Macro on new Editor does not work

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Creating new decisions prevents certain fields from showing up in the decision overview page.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Decisions Blueprint
# Create a decision page. Enter the information about the decision, outcome, and stakeholders. 
# ONce you save the decision page, access the Decision log. 

h3. Expected Results
* Decision log should retrieve the Stakeholders, outcome etc from the created decision page. 

h3. Actual Results
* Decision log page doesn't retrieve the Stakeholders, outcome etc from the created decision page. 
 
h3. Workaround

# Go to the Decision page and *Edit* it
# Change the *Contributors* field in the table to *Stakeholders*
# *Publish* the Page
(The same workaround can be applied to other fields that are not being rendered in the Decision Log)
fields.summary: Decision log page doesn't retrieve some information

fields.description: The ability to add inline comments is a powerful tools. Unfortunately, it is not possible to add inline comments in macros. This is especially annoying for things like code. Being able to comment directly on pieces of code would be a tremendous addition.
fields.summary: In-line comments within Macros

fields.description:
According to Confluence new editing experience

* https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html

All the meeting notes blueprint is now on new editor which would not be appropriate for users who used to modify their meeting notes blueprint accordingly to the old editor. Some formattings do not applicable when using the old editor. It would be beneficial if the user is allowed to choose between the old/new editor in customizing their meeting note blueprint.
fields.summary: Ability to switch between the old/new editor on Meeting note template

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Firefox browser, when you try to search anything under Confluence by clicking the middle mouse button, it opens the page in a new tab as expected but the original search panel closes.
h3. Environment

Firefox
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to your test site in Firefox browser.
 # Switch to Confluence wiki and use the *search icon* on the left panel.
 # Click the middle mouse button to open any search result in a new tab.
 # The original test panel where the results were displayed disappears.

h3. Expected Results

The search panel should be open with the results
h3. Actual Results

The search panel disappears and the user has to open the search icon again
h3. Workaround

Works fine in Chrome

Cmd (Control) + click
fields.summary: Firefox - Clicking middle mouse button to open new-tab closes the actual search panel

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Confluence, when creating a new space with the *Software Project* template, the tasks used as an example will be able to be checked and the following message is displayed:

{quote}
Oops! Your task change couldn't be saved. There could be a few reasons for this.
{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new space in Confluence (either through the dashboard, if not customized or through the *Spaces* directory from the sidebar)
# Select the *Software Project* template and link it to a Jira project
# Check one of the tasks used as an example 

h3. Expected Results
The tasks should be able to be checked and work as a demonstration for the user

h3. Actual Results
The following is displayed:

!task.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes

Manually created tasks work on the same page. Even if putting it under the current existing task list.

h3. Workaround
Manually create a new task, instead of using the default/example ones.
fields.summary: Checking tasks on newly created Software Project spaces are not working

Hey all! Editor PM here. Just a quick update to let you know we'll shortly be rolling out the ability for you to search for pages across your entire Confluence instance, not just recently viewed.

We still don't have plans for search and insert of files stored elsewhere. If/when we do, we'll let you all know.

Cheers,

Jonno Katahanas | Product Manager, Atlassian Cloud Editor

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As of the GDPR changes, vendors are making some extra requests to the user api.
In Jira, the bulk user api (https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/#api-api-2-user-bulk-get) is a big improvement on this.

Vendors would like to achieve the same in our Confluence application as well, as it would increase the performance of their application, and decrease the number of requests made to Confluence.
fields.summary: Make the bulk user rest api available for Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
From vendor:

{quote}
We are trying to review the UX of our Balsamiq Wireframes app for Confluence Cloud in order to address the changes triggered by the new Confluence live macro UI.

In order to take advantage of the new way to insert macro (i.e. "/") it would be useful to be able to launch the custom macro editor programmatically, without the need to click the "pencil" icon. This will save some clicks to the user.

This is particularly needed the first time a macro is inserted in a page (i.e. a new Balsamiq project has to be contextually created).

The scenario is illustrated by this screencast
http://recordit.co/d7F3V7wXYX
{quote}
fields.summary: Launch macro editor programmatically on new live macro

fields.description:
From a vendor:

Modules of Confluence Cloud addons can receive custom data from "ac.*" query parameters, as documented on https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/context-parameters/#apps.

When navigating to a module using AP.navigator.go(), custom data can be passed using the "customData" property in the context parameter, as documented on https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/jsapi/classes/context/. However, this property is only available for the "addonModule" target.

We would like to pass a custom parameter to a general page that is configured to be the contentViewComponent for a custom content type. We navigate to this page using AP.navigator.go('contentview'). This doesn't allow us to pass custom data.

Alternatively, we can navigate to the page using AP.navigator.go('addonModule'). This allows us to pass custom data, but it doesn't allow us to pass a content id.

Our workaround is to pass the content ID in a custom parameter, and on the general page take either the custom parameter or the content ID, depending on whether it was called from an AP.navigator.go('addonModule') call or directly from the Confluence UI.

It would be nice if AP.navigator.go() would accept custom data also for other targets than addonModule.
fields.summary: Allow passing custom data in AP.navigator.go() for all contexts

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Task Report, and Jira Report blueprints/templates can't be used if the new editor is enabled for all new blank pages.

h3. Environment
* The new editor must be enabled for new blank pages

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click on the plus sign button
# Choose the Task Report blueprint/Jira Report
# Select any option
# enter the needed information (any valid information will cause the issue)

h3. Expected Results
The page should be created with the blueprint.

h3. Actual Results
An error message is shown and the page is not created:
| !Screen Shot 2019-01-03 at 19.50.01.png|thumbnail! |
 
The error's transcription:
{code}We can't create that blueprint right now.

Unrecognized field "content" (Class com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.createcontent.rest.entities.CreateBlueprintPageRestEntity), not marked as ignorable at [Source: org.apache.catalina.connector.CoyoteInputStream@2c9a15e2; line: 1, column: 327] (through reference chain: com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.createcontent.rest.entities.CreateBlueprintPageRestEntity["content"]){code}

h3. Notes
This also happens for the Project Task Report template, with the following error:
{code}We can't create that blueprint right now.

Instantiation of [simple type, class com.atlassian.confluence.api.model.content.template.ContentTemplateId] value failed: For input string: "location-task-report-template" (through reference chain: com.atlassian.confluence.api.model.content.template.ContentBlueprintInstance["contentBlueprintSpec"]->com.atlassian.confluence.api.model.content.template.ContentBlueprintSpec["contentTemplateId"]){code}

h3. Workaround

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Confluence Cloud, if the user is using the [Excerpt Include macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/excerpt-include-macro-724765190.html] in order to retrieve content from a page that has specific characters (like ":"), the same will display the following result on the copy:

*"Error rendering macro 'excerpt-include': No link could be created for 'specific page: specific character"*

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Confluence, make sure to create a new page and use the *Excerpt macro* in order to include content to be retrieved on the next page. This page *must have* characters like ":" in which is what has been used for the test.
 # Create a second page and use the *Excerpt Include* macro in order to point to the first page.
# Use the *Copy* function for the second page and save the newly created page from this copy

h3. Expected Results
The copy should be properly displaying the Excerpt Include content.

h3. Actual Results
Instead of having the content, the message below is displayed:
*"Error rendering macro 'excerpt-include': No link could be created for 'specific page: specific character"*

h3. Notes
* A video has been recorded with the steps to reproduce. The *excerpt* video can be found on the attachments of this request.
* This seems to be happening with copied pages because the same remove the *space key* from the macro parameter, hence, making the macro to not identify it.
* Simply tapping on the excerpt include macro in order to *edit* and then, searching for the page will automatically adjust it.
* Pages without specific characters are not affected once the same *does not use* a space key as a reference.

h3. Workaround
* Instead of using the *Copy* function, try to manually copy the content with the excerpt to a new page.
* Change the tile of the pages using the affected character
fields.summary: Copying a page with the Excerpt Include macro breaks it if having specific characters
